template.name: Template SNMP D-link DGS-3100-xx
template.description: RlEnvMonState/ciscoEnvMonState{ normal(1), warning(2), critical(3), shutdown(4), notPresent(5), notFunctioning(6) }

item.name: Device CPU utilization
item.description: The time scale is set at 5 minute intervals. The value will be between 0% (idle) and 100% (very busy).

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth.
